data.name: Hon re uti possidetis
data.desc: Gov of Jam Thomas Lynch claims right to Sp Main settlements by uti possidetis under 1670 Treaty of Madrid
data.prim_n: Bib Real DIG/II/2857 ff 146r-161v / Add MS 11410 ff 183, 192v  / 742 CSPC [missg] [pp 322-323]
data.note:
Similar claims made re Cayman Isl, Virgin Isl, St Lucia, Tobago, other islands /v Hanna 118 /CO 324/7 ff 152-159 /Add MS 11410 ff 266v-267 /Sloane l[missg]vii /1066 CSPC 11 [7 May 1683 p 429] /
 10 May 1672 Godolphin to Arlington. Recommends HM not authorise logwood settlements, but rather connive at them / See Historical Manuscripts Commissison, *Weston Papers*, 10th report [Lon, sn, 1885], appendix, part 1 pp 200-201 /v Socolow 280 /
 16 May 1672 Modyford to Arlington. Recommends uti posseditis claim be made under American / Godolphin Treaty for Campeachy or Hon /v Socolow 180 /v Burdon 1 53 /
 22 Jun 1672 Queen Regent of Spain issues real c√©dula to treat invaders and those who trade without licence [inc Baymen] as pirates /38-45 CSPC 30 /v Botella-Ordinas 146 /
 Re [contemporaneous?] Spanish complaints of Eng logging see Bib Esp MS 13979 ff 439-440 [Apuntes sobre el corte del palo de Campeachy, con un croquis de Guat] /v Botella-Ordinas 147
